sen.j: 石井 貞興（いしい さだおき、天保13年（1842年）3月 - 明治10年（1877年）10月26日）は、幕末から明治初期にかけての肥前国佐賀藩士、政府地方官。
sen.e: Sadaoki ISHII (March, 1842 to October 26, 1877) was a feudal retainer of the Saga Domain of Hizen Province and chihokan (a local official) from the end of Edo Period to the early Meiji period.
Sadaoki ISHII (March, 1842 to October 26, 1877) was a feudal retainer of the Saga Domain of Hizen Province and a local official from the end of Edo Period to the early Meiji period.
sen.cmt: chihokanは不要と判断し削除しました。
sen.e: Sadaoki ISHII (March, 1842 to October 26, 1877) was a feudal retainer of the Saga Domain of Hizen Province and a local official from the end of Edo Period to the early Meiji period.

sen.j: 乙次、大作、竹之助と称する。
sen.e: He called himself Otsuji, daisaku and Takenosuke.
He called himself Otsuji, Daisaku and Takenosuke.
sen.cmt: daisakuを大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: He called himself Otsuji, Daisaku and Takenosuke.

sen.j: 佐賀藩士櫛山弥左衛門の長男として生まれ、伯父石井忠克の養子となる。
sen.e: He was born as the eldest son of Yasaemon KUSHIYAMA, a feudal retainer of the Saga clan and adopted by his uncle, Tadakatsu ISHII.
He was born as the eldest son of Yasaemon KUSHIYAMA, a feudal retainer of the Saga clan and adopted by his uncle, Tadakatsu ISHII.
He was born as the eldest son of Yasaemon KUSHIYAMA, a feudal retainer of the Saga clan and adopted by his uncle, Tadakatsu ISHII.

sen.j: 養家の石井家は、佐賀藩祖鍋島直茂の正室陽泰院の従弟石井忠教を祖とする家筋。
sen.e: His doptive family, the Iwai family originated by Tadakyo ISHII who was a cousine of Yotaiin, seishitsu (legal wife) of Naoshige NABESHIMA, the originator of Saga Domain.
His adoptive family, the Ishii family originated by Tadakyo ISHII who was a cousine of Yotaiin, the legal wife of Naoshige NABESHIMA, the originator of Saga Domain.
sen.cmt: doptiveをadoptiveに修正しました。Iwami FamilyはIshii Familyに修正しました。Seishitsuは削除しました。
sen.e: His adoptive family, the Ishii family originated by Tadakyo ISHII who was a cousine of Yotaiin, the legal wife of Naoshige NABESHIMA, the originator of Saga Domain.

sen.j: 貞興は、少年の頃から勉学に勤しみ、枝吉神陽、石井松堂に師事し、経学を修め、槍術や馬術にも秀でていた。
sen.e: Sadakyo was diligent in his studies since he was young, studied under Shinyo EDAYOSHI and Matsudo ISHII, learned keigaku (study of Keisho in Confucianism), and was excellent in archery and the art of the spearmanship.

Sadakyo was diligent in his studies since he was young, studied under Shinyo EDAYOSHI and Matsudo ISHII, learned keigaku (study of Keisho in Confucianism), and was excellent in archery and the art of the spearmanship.

Sadakyo was diligent in his studies since he was young, studied under Shinyo EDAYOSHI and Matsudo ISHII, learned keigaku (study of Keisho in Confucianism), and was excellent in archery and the art of the spearmanship.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争に従軍後、明治2年（1869年）、東京に上り昌平坂学問所（東京大学の前身）に学び、さらに薩摩藩の造士館にも学んだ。
sen.e: After taking a part in a campaign for the Boshin War, he went to Tokyo in 1869 to study at Shoheizaka Gakumonjo (Shoheizaka School), the predecessor of Tokyo University, and further more at Zoshikan school of Satsuma Domain.

After taking a part in a campaign for the Boshin War, he went to Tokyo in 1869 to study at Shoheizaka Gakumonjo (Shoheizaka School), the predecessor of Tokyo University, and further more at Zoshikan school of Satsuma Domain.

After taking a part in a campaign for the Boshin War, he went to Tokyo in 1869 to study at Shoheizaka Gakumonjo (Shoheizaka School), the predecessor of Tokyo University, and further more at Zoshikan school of Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: 造士館では、桐野利秋と昵懇の間柄となる。
sen.e: At Zoshikan school, he became a very close friend of Toshiaki KIRINO.
At Zoshikan school, he became a very close friend of Toshiaki KIRINO.
At Zoshikan school, he became a very close friend of Toshiaki KIRINO.

sen.j: その後、佐賀藩に帰国し、江藤新平の知遇を得て少参事に任ぜられ、藩の重職として活躍する。
sen.e: Later, he returned to the Saga Domain, got chigu (be taken under a person's wing) from Shinpei ETO and appointed as shosanji of the domain, and was active as a high-ranking official.
Later, he returned to the Saga Domain, got taken under a person's wing from Shinpei ETO and appointed as shosanji of the domain, and was active as a high-ranking official.
sen.cmt: chiguを削除し英文のみにしました。
sen.e: Later, he returned to the Saga Domain, got taken under a person's wing from Shinpei ETO and appointed as shosanji of the domain, and was active as a high-ranking official.

sen.j: しかし、間もなく辞任し、士族土着説を唱えて佐賀県長瀬村に隠遁し、田畑を耕し、家畜を飼う生活を送った。
sen.e: However, soon he resigned and adovocating the warrior class' nculturation, he retired into Nagase Village, Saga Prefecture and led a living cultivating the fields and raising stocks.
However, soon he resigned and adovocating the warrior class' inculturation, he retired into Nagase Village, Saga Prefecture and led a living cultivating the fields and raising stocks.
However, soon he resigned and adovocating the warrior class' inculturation, he retired into Nagase Village, Saga Prefecture and led a living cultivating the fields and raising stocks.

sen.j: 明治6年、佐賀県庁に復帰し、権典事に任官し、間もなく大属に昇進し、県庁を牛耳るようになる。
sen.e: In 1873 he returned to the Saga prefectural governmentin which he was appointed as Gontenj (middle-class clerk), and soon was promoted to Daisakan (senior clerk) and to dominate the government.
In 1873 he returned to the Saga prefectural governmentin which he was appointed as Gontenj (middle-class clerk), and soon was promoted to Daisakan (senior clerk) and to dominate the government.
In 1873 he returned to the Saga prefectural governmentin which he was appointed as Gontenj (middle-class clerk), and soon was promoted to Daisakan (senior clerk) and to dominate the government.

sen.j: その後、新政府に不満を持つ県庁内の旧佐賀藩士を糾合し、旧主鍋島家の資産を軍資金として流用して、征韓党を形成。
sen.e: Later he rallyed the former feudal retainers of the Saga clan who were discontent with the new government and organized Seikan (subjugation of Korea) party by diverting the assets of the Nabeshima family as war funds.

Later he rallyed the former feudal retainers of the Saga clan who were discontent with the new government and organized Seikan (subjugation of Korea) party by diverting the assets of the Nabeshima family as war funds.

Later he rallyed the former feudal retainers of the Saga clan who were discontent with the new government and organized Seikan (subjugation of Korea) party by diverting the assets of the Nabeshima family as war funds.

sen.j: 江藤新平を領袖に擁して、明治7年（1874年）、佐賀戦争（佐賀の乱）を起こした。
sen.e: Having Shinpei ETO as leader, he started Saga War in 1874.
Having Shinpei ETO as leader, he started Saga War in 1874.
Having Shinpei ETO as leader, he started Saga War in 1874.

sen.j: しかし、佐賀城陥落の直前に脱出して、鹿児島県に逃れ、旧知の桐野利秋のもとで匿われる。
sen.e: However, just before the fall of Saga-jo Castle, he escaped to Kagoshima Prefecture and was provided shelter by hid Toshiaki KIRINO
However, just before the fall of Saga-jo Castle, he escaped to Kagoshima Prefecture and was provided shelter by Toshiaki KIRINO
However, just before the fall of Saga-jo Castle, he escaped to Kagoshima Prefecture and was provided shelter by Toshiaki KIRINO

sen.j: 明治10年（1877年）、西南戦争の勃発に際して旧薩摩藩軍に身を投じ、活躍するも、敗戦後、熊本県の山中に身を隠すも逮捕された。
sen.e: In 1877 at the outbreak of Seinan War he joined the army of the former Satsuma Domain and was active, and after the war he hid himself in a mountain in Kumamoto Prefecture but was captured.
In 1877 at the outbreak of Seinan War he joined the army of the former Satsuma Domain and fought with them, and after the war he hid himself in a mountain in Kumamoto Prefecture but was captured.
sen.cmt: and was activeをand fought with themに変更しました。
sen.e: In 1877 at the outbreak of Seinan War he joined the army of the former Satsuma Domain and fought with them, and after the war he hid himself in a mountain in Kumamoto Prefecture but was captured.

sen.j: 逮捕後、長崎に移送され、斬首の刑に処せられた。
sen.e: After being captured, he was moved to Nagasaki and was punished by decapitation.
After being captured, he was moved to Nagasaki and was punished by decapitation.
sen.cmt: was punished by decapitationをwas decapitatedに変更しました。
sen.e: After being captured, he was moved to Nagasaki and was punished by decapitation.

sen.j: 享年36。
sen.e: His age at death was 36.
His age at death was 36.
His age at death was 36.

sen.j: 墓所は佐賀市長瀬の東光寺にある。
sen.e: His graveyard is located in Toko-ji Temple at Nagase, Saga city.
His graveyard is located in Toko-ji Temple at Nagase, Saga city.
His graveyard is located in Toko-ji Temple at Nagase, Saga city.

sen.j: 佐賀戦争首謀者の中で最後まで生き残り、士族最後の反乱である西南戦争まで戦ったことから"佐賀のラストサムライ"と呼ばれることもある。
sen.e: Because he was the last survivor among the ringleaders of the Saga War and fought in the Seinan War which was the last rebellion of shizoku (family or person with samurai ancestors), he is sometimes called "Saga's Last Samurai".

Because he was the last survivor among the ringleaders of the Saga War and fought in the Seinan War which was the last rebellion of shizoku (family or person with samurai ancestors), he is sometimes called "Saga's Last Samurai".

Because he was the last survivor among the ringleaders of the Saga War and fought in the Seinan War which was the last rebellion of shizoku (family or person with samurai ancestors), he is sometimes called "Saga's Last Samurai".

sen.j: 司馬遼太郎の『歳月』では、征韓党の武断派と評されているが、『江藤新平伝』等によれば、子煩悩な心優しい紳士であった一面も見られる。
sen.e: "Saigetsu"(across the ages) authored by Ryotaro SHIBA considers him as a member of Budan-ha (military government group), but according to"Shinpei ETO Biography"he had one side of being of a doting parent type and kindhearted persons.

"Saigetsu"(across the ages) authored by Ryotaro SHIBA considers him as a member of Budan-ha (military government group), but according to"Shinpei ETO Biography"he was also a doting parent and kindearted gentleman.
sen.cmt: he had one side of being of a doting parent type and kindhearted personsを he was also a doting parent and kindearted gentlemanに変更しました。
sen.e: "Saigetsu"(across the ages) authored by Ryotaro SHIBA considers him as a member of Budan-ha (military government group), but according to"Shinpei ETO Biography"he was also a doting parent and kindearted gentleman.

sen.j: なお、妻は久米邦郷の娘朗（久米邦武の妹）。
sen.e: His wife was Kunisato KUME's daughter (younger sister of Kunitake KUME.
His wife was Kunisato KUME's daughter (younger sister of Kunitake KUME.
His wife was Kunisato KUME's daughter (younger sister of Kunitake KUME.

sen.j: 次男石井八万次郎は東京大学理学部出身の地質学者。
sen.e: His second son, Rikisaburo ISHII was a geological scientist who graduated from School of Science, Tokyo University.
His second son, Rikisaburo ISHII was a geological scientist who graduated from School of Science, Tokyo University.
His second son, Rikisaburo ISHII was a geological scientist who graduated from School of Science, Tokyo University.

sen.j: 三男石井力三郎は海軍少佐である。
sen.e: His third son, Rikisaburo ISHII was a navy major.
His third son, Rikisaburo ISHII was a navy major.
His third son, Rikisaburo ISHII was a navy major.

sen.j: 力三郎の養子石井龍猪は、台湾総督府内務局長、殖産局長、台北市長、台南州知事等を歴任している。
sen.e: Ryucho ISHII, an adopted child of Rikisaburo held positions such as Director of Interior Bureau, Taiwan Sotoku-fu, Director of Industry Bureau, Taiwan Sotoku-fu, Taihoku City Governor, Tainan-shu Prefectural Governor.

Ryucho ISHII, an adopted child of Rikisaburo held positions such as Director of Interior Bureau, Taiwan Sotoku-fu, Director of Industry Bureau, Taiwan Sotoku-fu, Taipei City Governor, Tainan-shu Prefectural Governor.

Ryucho ISHII, an adopted child of Rikisaburo held positions such as Director of Interior Bureau, Taiwan Sotoku-fu, Director of Industry Bureau, Taiwan Sotoku-fu, Taipei City Governor, Tainan-shu Prefectural Governor.
